alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 11:36PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Meagher, southwestern Judith Basin and southeastern Cascade Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1135 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 28 miles northwest of White Sulphur Springs to 25 miles west of Harlowton. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Neihart, Martinsdale, Fort Logan On The Smith River, Checkerboard, Newlan Creek Reservoir and Lennep. This includes the following highways... Highway 12 between mile markers 45 and 77. Highway 89 between mile markers 1 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to minor localized flooding and debris flow down steep terrain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
